com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp

Class OtpModule

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static OtpModule create()
        Create OtpModule object.
        Returns:
        Otp Module.

      • isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ

        public boolean isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ(java.lang.String tokenName)
                                     throws IdpException
        Check if the migration is needed for Android Q with the given token name. If the migration is needed, app should ask the end user for the permission READ_PHONE_STATE and then call the migration API migrateForAndroidQ(String, byte[]).

        NOTE: This API should be called during the application startup to make sure that the permission popup, if any, will not interfere with other business flow.

        For more information on Android Q privacy changes, refer to https://developer.android.com/preview/privacy/data-identifiers#device-ids

        Parameters:
        tokenName - The token name.
        Returns:
        true if migration is needed, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IdpStorageException - When database operation failed.
        PasswordManagerException - When the TOKEN domain is not logged in using the password manager.
        IdpException
        Since:
        4.9.2
        See Also:
        migrateForAndroidQ(String, byte[])

      • migrateForAndroidQ

        public void migrateForAndroidQ(java.lang.String tokenName,
                               byte[] customData)
                        throws IdpException
        Migrate the old token to be compatible with Android Q. In order to retrieve the old token, this API needs the READ_PHONE_STATE permission to be granted. After the migration, the permission is not required anymore.

        For more information on Android Q privacy changes, refer to https://developer.android.com/preview/privacy/data-identifiers#device-ids

        Parameters:
        tokenName - The name of the token to be migrated.
        customData - The custom data.
        Throws:
        IdpStorageException - When database operation failed.
        PasswordManagerException - When the TOKEN domain is not logged in using the password manager.
        DeviceFingerprintException - When the fingerprint data does not match.
        IdpException
        Since:
        4.9.2
        See Also:
        isMigrationNeededForAndroidQ(String)

      • reset

        public boolean reset()
              throws IdpException
        Cleanup the data associated with OTP module. Tokens that have been provisioned before will be removed.
        Returns:
        true if rest is successful.
        Throws:
        IdpException - when database operation failed.
        Since:
        4.9.0
        See Also:
        IdpCore.reset()
